fields.description: The unique identifier for this grant. Made up of your 360 Giving prefix, and an identifier from your records. See the [360Giving Grant identifier guidance](http://docs.threesixtygiving.org/identifiers/#grant-identifier) for details.
fields.title: Identifier
fields.name: id

fields.description: A title for this grant activity. This should be under 140 characters long.
fields.title: Title
fields.name: title

fields.description: A short description of this grant activity.
fields.title: Description
fields.name: description

fields.description: The currency used in amounts. Use the three-digit currency code from [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)
fields.title: Currency
fields.name: currency

fields.description: Total amount applied for in numbers (do not include commas or currency symbols such as £). If you have provided detailed transaction information on a separate table, this should equal the sum of all the application transactions for this grant.
fields.title: Amount Applied For
fields.name: amountAppliedFor

fields.description: Total amount awarded in numbers (do not include commas or currency symbols such as £). If you have provided detailed transaction information on a separate table, this should equal the sum of all the award transactions for this grant.
fields.title: Amount Awarded
fields.name: amountAwarded

fields.description: Total amount disbursed (paid) to this grantee when this record was last updated (in numbers: do not include commas or currency symbols such as £)). If you have provided detailed transaction information on a separate table, this should equal the sum of all the disbursement transactions for this grant.
fields.title: Amount Disbursed
fields.name: amountDisbursed

fields.description: When was the decision to award this grant made. Dates should be in YYYY-MM-DD format.
fields.title: Award Date
fields.name: awardDate

fields.description: A URL (Web Address) where further information about this grant can be found. This could point to the website of the recipient organisation, or might link to further details on the funders website.
fields.title: URL
fields.name: url

fields.description: When the applicant / implementing organisation originally intend this activity to take place.  All events should have a start date. Dates should be in YYYY-MM-DD format. If the month or day are not available, these may be omitted.
fields.title: Planned Dates:Start Date
fields.name: plannedDates[]/startDate

fields.description: When the applicant / implementing organisation originally intend this activity to take place.  Events or activities lasting more than one day should have either a duration (in months) or an end date. Dates should be in YYYY-MM-DD format. If the month or day are not available, these may be omitted.
fields.title: Planned Dates:End Date
fields.name: plannedDates[]/endDate

fields.description: When the applicant / implementing organisation originally intend this activity to take place.  Events or activities lasting more than one day should have either a duration (in months) or an end date.
fields.title: Planned Dates:Duration (months)
fields.name: plannedDates[]/duration

fields.description: Details of the recipient of this grant. A globally unique identifier for this organisation. This is important to enable data on funders and recipients to be linked up across different grant-makers. The [Organisation Identifier Standard](http://docs.threesixtygiving.org/identifiers/#organisation-identifier) guidance explains how to create this ID, based either on the known company or charity number, or upon identifiers held in the grant-maker's internal systems.
fields.title: Recipient Org:Identifier
fields.name: recipientOrganization[]/id

fields.description: Details of the recipient of this grant. Organisation name
fields.title: Recipient Org:Name
fields.name: recipientOrganization[]/name

fields.description: Details of the recipient of this grant. Registered charity number, if applicable.
fields.title: Recipient Org:Charity Number
fields.name: recipientOrganization[]/charityNumber

fields.description: Details of the recipient of this grant. Registered UK company number, if applicable.
fields.title: Recipient Org:Company Number
fields.name: recipientOrganization[]/companyNumber

fields.description: Details of the recipient of this grant. Building number and street name.
fields.title: Recipient Org:Street Address
fields.name: recipientOrganization[]/streetAddress

fields.description: Details of the recipient of this grant. City or town.
fields.title: Recipient Org:City
fields.name: recipientOrganization[]/addressLocality

fields.description: Details of the recipient of this grant. Postal code (please try and provide a post code whenever possible)
fields.title: Recipient Org:Postal Code
fields.name: recipientOrganization[]/postalCode

fields.description: Information about the location of beneficiaries. Further information about beneficiaries can be provided through classifications. A name for this location.
fields.title: Beneficiary Location:Name
fields.name: beneficiaryLocation[]/name

fields.description: Information about the location of beneficiaries. Further information about beneficiaries can be provided through classifications. The ISO Country Code of the location of this activity.
fields.title: Beneficiary Location:Country Code
fields.name: beneficiaryLocation[]/countryCode

fields.description: Information about the location of beneficiaries. Further information about beneficiaries can be provided through classifications. The latitude of a point location
fields.title: Beneficiary Location:Latitude
fields.name: beneficiaryLocation[]/latitude

fields.description: Information about the location of beneficiaries. Further information about beneficiaries can be provided through classifications. The longitude of a point location
fields.title: Beneficiary Location:Longitude
fields.name: beneficiaryLocation[]/longitude

fields.description: Information about the location of beneficiaries. Further information about beneficiaries can be provided through classifications. A code referring to a geographical area, drawn from an established gazetteer. For example, the code for a local authority ward, or parliamentary constituency.
fields.title: Beneficiary Location:Geographic Code
fields.name: beneficiaryLocation[]/geoCode

fields.description: Information about the location of beneficiaries. Further information about beneficiaries can be provided through classifications. The type of Geographic Code (geoCode) used (e.g. Ward, Parliamentary Constituency etc.). This value for this field should be drawn from the [codelist of geographic code types](https://github.com/ThreeSixtyGiving/standard/tree/master/codelists/geoCodeType.csv).
fields.title: Beneficiary Location:Geographic Code Type
fields.name: beneficiaryLocation[]/geoCodeType

fields.description: Details of the funder A globally unique identifier for this organisation. This is important to enable data on funders and recipients to be linked up across different grant-makers. The [Organisation Identifier Standard](http://docs.threesixtygiving.org/identifiers/#organisation-identifier) guidance explains how to create this ID, based either on the known company or charity number, or upon identifiers held in the grant-maker's internal systems.
fields.title: Funding Org:Identifier
fields.name: fundingOrganization[]/id

fields.description: Details of the funder Organisation name
fields.title: Funding Org:Name
fields.name: fundingOrganization[]/name

fields.description: Details of the funder The department or sub-unit of this organisation making or receiving the grant.
fields.title: Funding Org:Department
fields.name: fundingOrganization[]/department

fields.description: - An identifier for this grant programme.
fields.title: Grant Programme:Code
fields.name: grantProgramme[]/code

fields.description: - The title of this grant programme.
fields.title: Grant Programme:Title
fields.name: grantProgramme[]/title

fields.description: - A web link to more details of this grant programme.
fields.title: Grant Programme:URL
fields.name: grantProgramme[]/url

fields.description: Was this grant made as the result of an open call for applications? Values should be 'Yes' or 'No'
fields.title: From an open call?
fields.name: fromOpenCall

fields.description: The date when information on this grant was last updated
fields.title: Last modified
fields.name: dateModified

fields.description: A web link pointing to the source of this data. This may be an original 360Giving data file, a file from which the data was converted, or an organisation website.
fields.title: Data Source
fields.name: dataSource
